definition.name: sub_Gaussian_tails
definition.definition: The Phi^4_3 measure mu has sub-Gaussian tails: for any continuous linear functional L on D'(T^3), there exists C > 0 such that E_mu[exp(alpha L(phi))] <= exp(C alpha^2) for all alpha in R. This follows from the quartic interaction providing stronger concentration than the Gaussian free field.
